Format ae_format88_2 - 88 bit(s)00000000 001111
FLOAT.SX2 1000000110100 0 10
fld_vfpu2_sem_sp32cvt_vt 3210
fld_vfpu2_sem_sp32cvt_vr 3210
fld_vfpu2_sem_sp32cvt_i_imm5 4 3210

Assembler Syntax

FLOAT.SX2 aed0..15(opnd_vfpu2_sem_sp32cvt_vt), aed0..15(opnd_vfpu2_sem_sp32cvt_vr), 0..31

C Syntax

#include <xtensa/tie/xt_FP.h>

extern xtfloatx2 XT_FLOAT_SX2(ae_int32x2 s, immediate t);

Description

(please consult the Xtensa ® Instruction Set Architecture Reference Manual for any cross references and additional information)

FLOAT.SX2 converts the contents of each half of data register fs from signed integer to single-precision format. Each converted integer value is then scaled by a power of two constant value encoded in the t field, with 0..31 representing 1.0, 0.5, 0.25, …, 1.0÷S2147483648.0. The scaling allows for a fixed point notation where the binary point is at the right end of the integer for t=0 and moves to the left as t increases until for t=31 there are 31 fractional bits represented in the fixed point number. The result is written to the both halves of data register frr.

Operation

For each corresponding half: 

AE_DR[r] ← floatS(AE_DR[s]) ×S powS(2.0,-t)

FSR[StatusFlags: I] ← Or in update

Exceptions

  • EveryInst Group
  • GenExcep(Coprocessor0Disabled) if Coprocessor Context Option

Implementation Pipeline

In Out
RoundMode Mstage, InexactFlag Wstage+2, opnd_vfpu2_sem_sp32cvt_vr Mstage InexactFlag Wstage+2, opnd_vfpu2_sem_sp32cvt_vt Wstage

Protos that use FLOAT.SX2

proto FLOAT.SX2 { out xtfloatx2 r, in ae_int32x2 s, in immediate t }{}{
FLOAT.SX2 r, s, t + 0;
}
proto ae_int32x2_rtor_xtfloatx2 { out xtfloatx2 o, in ae_int32x2 i }{}{
FLOAT.SX2 o, i, 0;
}
